text: Justice Anderson may refer to: *Albert Anderson (jurist), an Associate Justice of the Montana Supreme Court *Alexander O. Anderson, a Tennessee lawyer who served in the United States Senate, and as a judge on the California Supreme Court from 1851 to 1853 *Barry Anderson, an Associate Justice of the Minnesota Supreme Court *Donald B. Anderson, an Associate Justice of the Idaho Supreme Court *E. Riley Anderson (1932–2018), former Chief Justice of the Tennessee Supreme Court *Forrest H. Anderson, an Associate Justice of the Montana Supreme Court from 1953 to 1956 *Francis T. Anderson, a judge on the Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals from 1870 to 1883 *Frank Anderson (judge), an Associate Justice of the South Dakota Supreme Court *James A. Andersen, an Associate Justice of the Washington Supreme Court *John C. Anderson (judge), an Associate Justice and Chief Justice of the Alabama Supreme Court *John W. Anderson (Iowa judge), an Associate Justice of the Iowa Supreme Court *Paul Anderson (judge), an Associate Justice of the Minnesota Supreme Court *Ralph J. Anderson, an Associate Justice of the Montana Supreme Court *Reuben V. Anderson, an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of Mississippi *Thomas J. Anderson (judge), an Associate Justice of the Utah Supreme Court *Russell A. Anderson, the 20th Chief Justice of the Minnesota Supreme Court *Walker Anderson, an Associate Justice of the Florida Supreme Court from 1851 to 1853 *William D. Anderson, an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of Mississippi
title: Justice Anderson
